channel.title: Comments for page "Monochrome Guide"
channel.description: Posts in the discussion thread "Monochrome Guide"

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
Let me quote the guide for you:
"if you have all 3 from previous seasons you instead get Eclipsed"

Yes you need to do it 4 times.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
Does all this mean you need to run it 4 times?

Like, when you complete it the third time, do you get bloodline bonus AND eclipsed, or just bloodline bonus?

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: I think that Miss Kitty's jutsu should be noted in the guide as well. A 500% Ally/Event Find chance with no stat penalties is extremely useful for getting some of the harder allies (that is if you can't use a mono pheromone). Its an expensive jutsu, but it definitely shouldn't be overlooked.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Goodboy2 also helps a lot if you have/were planning to get Trade3 anyway

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: If you are having trouble with doing Monochrome, work on getting the Arena bonuses, like the new M-Ball, et al. It's really worth it to do Monochrome. If you feel that you're too weak to do it, make sure you do everything else that season that you need to, first- That'll let your levels reach cap, which makes it a LOT easier to do instead of sitting in low-twenties.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: U should do one by one. Mega-fight counts as one moon change. I use Emergency Rations, but my friends like to use Anticoagulant. Usually it takes 1 or 2 days to get enough wins.

item.title: Full Moon?!
item.content:encoded:
Umm i'm done with everything except for getting the full moon. Can i get the full moon by using the "use all fights at once" option or do i have to fight one by one which pretty much means i can forget monochrome since that way is just way to hard.

Anybody know of any ways that could make this step any easier?

item.title: "..so bring mcstripeypants along"
item.content:encoded: at the hollow jaw section. he only improves ally find, why would you want to bring him along? i think the only thing that improves item find in reaper on a case by case basis is greass, i think

item.title: "Almost imposible to brute force"
item.content:encoded: Brute Forcing Mr. Tea is somewhat of a common practice in later runs, so saying that it's almost imposible is inacurate. Almost imposible durring your first run, would be better.

item.title: Re: Monster drop
item.content:encoded: As long as your character has won a drop from a monster at some point, it doesn't matter which season.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: if you get a monster drop once throughout your whole life, does it check for that, or do u need one drop per season?

item.title: Eclipsed
item.content:encoded: Would it be possible that you get it if you just complete mono with a bloodline item you already have? Say you had Sight Beyond Sight, and beat it again as a RedEye, for instance.

item.title: Removal
item.content:encoded:
Gaining Access to Dark Hours
Note: If you have gotten to this point without attaining Jonin rank (you brute forced Mister Tea instead of using the jutsu), note that it is believed that from this point forward you must be Jonin,
as there have been several reports that you can't get any of the missions that require Awesome Pants at any lower rank, even if you have the Pants.

The above should be removed from the guide, as currently one needs the A-level allies Hermano and Fletch to even get the hall pass(since they are a requirement for "Adventures in the Other Side").
